Create a new sandbox from a production instance and the names are literally Developer, Developer Pro, Partial Copy and Full.

A B D E

A. Developer sandbox: A Developer sandbox is a copy of your production environment that you can use to build and test new features, customizations, and configurations.

B. Developer Pro sandbox: A Developer Pro sandbox is a copy of your production environment that includes more data and is refreshed more frequently than a Developer sandbox.

D. Full Sandbox: A Full sandbox is a complete copy of your production environment, including all your data and metadata.

E. Partial Sandbox: A Partial sandbox is a copy of your production environment that includes a subset of your data and metadata.

comments.content:
Wrong options:

A. Enabling the "Preserve Lead Status" option in the lead conversion settings has no direct bearing on reporting on converted leads. This option refers to keeping the lead's original status after conversion, but does not provide a way to create or access specific reports.

B. Ensuring the rep has read access to the original lead records is not enough to meet the need to report on converted leads. This would only allow the rep to view the details of the original leads, but would not provide an efficient way to create reports dedicated to leads that have already converted.

D. Assigning "View and Edit" permissions to "Converted Leads" is not directly related to creating reports. This option might allow reps to view and edit the converted records, but it wouldn't help them create custom reports for data analysis.

The correct option is C because it allows sales reps to create custom reports focusing on leads that have converted, directly addressing the need for reporting on converted leads. The other options are not aligned with this specific need.

discussion.content:
The correct alternative is C. Create a custom report type with "Converted Leads" as the main object.

This is because the need mentioned in the statement is to allow sales representatives to generate reports on the leads that were converted. By creating a custom report type with "Converted Leads" as the main object, sales reps can create specific reports that focus on which leads have been converted. This will allow them to view relevant information about these leads after conversion, which is important for measuring the success of conversions and making informed decisions in the sales process. The other options don't directly address the need for reporting on converted leads.

questions.question_text:
After Universal Containers converts qualified leads, sales reps need to be able to report on converted leads.

How should an app builder support this requirement?

choices.B: Ensure the representative has Read access to the original lead records.
choices.D: Assign the representative View and Edit Converted Leads permission.
choices.A: Enable Preserve Lead Status in the lead conversion settings.
choices.C: Create a custom report type with Converted Leads as the primary object.

discussion.content:
I think this might be B - Update the support team profile to remove the Bronze record type.
removing the Bronze record type from the support team's profile would be the most direct and straightforward way to meet the requirement. Option C (Creating a permission set) would also be a possible solution, but it's a more complex solution than simply removing the record type from the profile.

ASK: "The customer support team should not be able to create new cases with the Bronze record type" -- The customer support team may still need to access the Bronze record type just not to create new cases.
VALID QUESTION: If we Update the support team profile to remove the Bronze record type, wont that prevent them from ultimately seeing cases related to the Bronze record?

Selected Answer: B
B is the only correct answer however in 2026 Record Type access will be on permission set groups instead of profiles.

Also just to clarify about why C (permission sets) is completely wrong: 

The question is implying that customer support has create abilities for all three objects currently. The question does not specify that we need to GIVE Create access for diamond or platinum but rather that the team should NOT have Create access for Bronze record types. Since this is the only ask in the question we have to assume they are trying to remove Create access on the bronze record type. Permission sets however can only ADD access they do not REMOVE it so C can not be correct.

Selected Answer: B
B as removing the record type from a profiles object settings removes the profile users ability to create a record with said record type

Cloud Kicks has three types of customer support processes: Platinum, Diamond, and Bronze. The app builder created separate record types for each process on the Case object. The customer support team should be unable to create new cases with the Bronze record type.

How should this requirement be met?

choices.D: Make the record type hidden to support users; update sharing rules to private.
choices.B: Update the support team profile to remove the Bronze record type.
choices.C: Create a permission set group for Case that includes Platinum and Diamond record types.
choices.A: Update the organization-wide defaults to private for Case.
